properties.name: Death Valley
properties.description: Posted by ChazisrazDeath Valley is a valley in the U.S. states of California and Nevada, and is the location of the lowest elevation in North America at 282 ft below sea level. It is extremely hot and dry for most of the year but there are actually some beatuiful sights and wildflowers there. Generally, the lower the altitude of a place, the higher the temperatures tend to be. This is especially true in Death Valley, due to the mountains that circle the valley. The valley creates extreme amounts of heat, creating temperatures that are among the highest on earth. The hottest temperature ever recorded in the United States was 134 Â°F.

properties.name: Empire State Building
properties.description: Posted by ChazisrazThe Empire State Building is a 102-story art deco skyscraper in New York City, New York at the intersection of Fifth Avenue and West 34th Street. Its name is derived from the nickname for the state of New York. It stood as the world\'s tallest building for more than forty years, from its completion in 1931 until construction of the World Trade Center\'s North Tower was completed in 1972. It also holds the record for the longest time as the tallest building in the world, a record most experts agree no existing or future building will ever break. At 9:40 a.m. on Saturday July 28, 1945, a B-25 Mitchell bomber, piloted by Lieutenant Colonel William F. Smith, Jr., who was flying in a thick fog, accidentally crashed into the north side of the Empire State Building between the 79th and 80th floors, where the offices of the National Catholic Welfare Council were located. One engine shot through the side opposite the impact and another plummeted down an elevator shaft. The fire was extinguished in 40 minutes.

properties.name: Leaning Tower of Pisa
properties.description: Posted by ChazisrazPisa, ItalyThe Leaning Tower of Pisa is a freestanding bell tower. It is situated behind the Cathedral and it is the third structure by time in Pisa\'s Piazza del Duomo. Although intended to stand vertically, the tower began leaning to the southeast soon after the construction in 1173 due to a poorly laid foundation and loose substrate that has allowed the foundation to shift direction.

properties.name: Mt. Everest
properties.description: Posted by ChazisrazMt. Everest is the highest mountain on Earth, as measured by the height of its summit above sea level, which is 8,848 meters or 29,028 feet. been 3,679 ascents to the summit by 2,436 individuals. There have been 210 deaths on the mountain, where conditions are so difficult that most corpses have been left where they fell; some are visible from standard climbing routes. Everest is the mountain whose summit attains the greatest distance above sea level. Several other mountains are sometimes claimed as alternative "tallest mountains on Earth". Mauna Kea in Hawaii is tallest when measured from its base;it rises over 10,200 m (6.3 mi) when measured from its base on the mid-ocean floor, but only attains 4,205 m above sea level.

properties.name: Mt. Rushmore
properties.description: Posted by ChazisrazLocationMt. Rushmore is a monumental granite sculpture located within the United States Presidential Memorial. It has the heads of four former United States presidents George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, Theodore Roosevelt, and Abraham Lincoln. Tourism is South Dakota\'s second-largest industry, with Mount Rushmore being its number one tourist attraction. In 2004, over two million visitors traveled to the memorial/

properties.name: Stonehenge
properties.description: Posted by ChazisrazStonehenge is a prehistoric monument located in the English county of Wiltshire. It is one of the most famous prehistoric sites in the world. Stonehenge is composed of earthworks surrounding a circular setting of large standing stones. It was made by all manual labor and a large amount of workers. When Stonehenge became open to the public it was possible to walk amongst and even climb on the stones. However this ended in 1977 when the stones were roped off as a result of serious erosion now visitors are not permitted to touch the stones, but only walk around the monument from a short distance. Visitors can make special bookings to access the stones throughout the year.

properties.name: The Colosseum
properties.description: Posted by ChazisrazThe Roman Colosseum is an elliptical amphitheatre in the centre of the city of Rome, Italy. It is the largest ever built in the Roman Empire. It is one of the greatest works of Roman architecture and engineering. Although it is now in a ruined condition due to damage caused by earthquakes and stone-robbers, the Colosseum has long been seen as an iconic symbol of Imperial Rome. Today it is one of modern Rome\'s most popular tourist attractions and still has close connections with the Roman Catholic Church.

properties.name: The Great Wall of China
properties.description: Posted by ChazisrazThe Great Wall stretches over approximately 6,400 km from Shanhaiguan in the east to Lop Nur in the west, along an arc that roughly delineates the southern edge of Inner Mongolia, but stretches to over 6,700 km in total. During the Ming Dynasty, however, bricks were heavily used in many areas of the wall, as were materials such as tiles, lime, and stone. The size and weight of the bricks made them easier to work with than earth and stone, so construction quickened. Additionally, bricks could bear more weight and endure better than rammed earth.

properties.name: The Sphinx
properties.description: Posted by ChazisrazThe Sphinx is depicted as a recumbent lion with a human head.It has its origins in sculpted figures of Old Kingdom Egypt. Which the ancient Greeks applied their own name for a female monster, the "strangler", an archaic figure of Greek mythology. From the Bronze Age the Hellenes had trade and cultural contacts with Egypt. Before the time that Alexander the Great occupied Egypt their name, sphinx, was already applied to these statues.

properties.name: The White House
properties.description: Posted by ChazisrazWashington, D.C.The White House is the home and workplace of the President of the United States of America. It is located at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW in Washington, D.C. Construction of the White House began with the laying of the cornerstone on October 13, 1792, with no formal ceremony. The main residence, as well as foundations of the house, were built largely by enslaved and free African-American laborers.
